Posts.Content: hello everyone .. let me introduce myself . I am a 55 year old grandma diagnosed in February with invasive ductal carcinoma .. opted for a wle and sentinel node biopsy . recovered from surgery but after receiving news that the 25mm tumour was stage 2 grade 3 bvut clear margins and no node involvement have had the oncotype dx test done .. am now waiting for those results, things seem to be going so slowly now after the initial rush and I am getting very frustrated waiting for results.. Am on letrozole for the meantime .. and back to hot flushes . I thought I was finished with these, lol x vast mood swings affecting me also , find I can cry at the drop of a hat !My wounds have healed quite well , though I still get the spasm pain in the breast sporadically . I think I will find this site a great comfort and look forward to getting to know everyone better and swapping experiences and thoughts .
Posts.Title: waiting for oncotype-dx results

Posts.Content: Hope we both get good news very soon x Dorothy
Posts.Title: waiting for oncotype-dx results

Posts.Content: hi , yer although I half expected it , it still was a body blow .  My score was 41 , quite high , and looks like I will be having first session on Friday . thanks for the good wishes .. fingers crossed for you . hope you don't have to wait much longer either cos its so hard x Will keep in touch .... Dorothy ...
Posts.Title: waiting for oncotype-dx results

Posts.Content: Hello Mumra... Three weeks ago past Friday (8th May ) my oncologist rang to say the funding was through for my samples to be sent off for the test . She told me she would have a result for me within 14 days and would ring with them .. not sure exactly which day my samples were sent off , but heard nothing yet , but expecting a phone call any day . its just frustrating every day wondering if this is the day . then getting to the evening and realising you have probably another sleepless night ahead worrying x If I need chemo then I will accept that , its just the not knowing and inability to plan anything x I am very emotional at the moment . not sure if it is the strain or the Letrozole
Posts.Title: waiting for oncotype-dx results

Posts.Content: well Mumra , have just had the long awaited phone call . unfortunately my score has come back high and will be starting on chemo asap . hope you get better news . x
Posts.Title: waiting for oncotype-dx results

Posts.Content: My oncotype-dx was also funded by NHS , think i was one of the first my oncologist put through on funding . worth the wait , even though my score came back as 41 and I start chemo tomorrow . at least i  know its not unnecessary and I will benefit from it in the long run  Dorothy
Posts.Title: My test was funded!

Posts.Content: Think I will find out all that info on Wednesday when I go for consent signing etc . I think the oncologist told me the drugs they use when I was there 4 weeks ago but chemo was not a certainty then and I cant remember the names .. I am sure I will get used to all the extra information and drug names etc as time goes on x I am sure I am going to find this site a great source of support and comfort and look forward to swapping experiences with others . . Dorothy
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi cycling girl .. good name ..i assume its because of being a cyclist .. I also like to cycle but have not had the opportunity this year yet because of illness and surgery . as to my chemo regimen .. i am having 6 FEC . I was at chemo unit yesterday for bloods and mrsa screening and chemo talk .. signing consent today and starting with first session tomorrow .. of course am anxious but at least things are happening . I waited so long for Oncotype dx results it seemed that nothing was gonna happen . now its all systems go x
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: HI all , just a quick question .. am on day8 following first FEC not suffered to badly .. mainly nausea but now have developed a spotty scalp and spots round my hairline . feel ok in myself up to now .. mouth ok etc  .. just wondering if developing the spots over the last day or so is something anyone else has experienced .No hair loss as yet , thanks x
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: well I suppose I should be joining this group too , as had my oncologist phone me this morning with results of oncotype -dx . I have scored 41 so chemo it is ! going to sign consent form on Wednesday and starting first session on Friday . Any advice from anyone to prepare would  be appreciated x Dorothy
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: HI  first chemo brought forward to Thursday . went ok not so scary as I thought .. till the side effect kick in I suppose .. Regime is 6 x FEC ..been a bit wobbly since Thursday night .. like a hangover feeling .. little nausea but sorted with meds . I find this site a great platform for support x you are a great lot . Dorothy
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: hi again all ,FEC 2 completed yesterday  , very nauseous last night , first ever vomiting at 4.15  this morning just one episode and settled my nausea and headache down .  been   a little ropey all day but tolerable . Hair almost all gone .. got my daughter to cut it very short last week when it was coming out in handfuls . have got a fetching wig and some lovely scarves and hats . scalp  not so sore now.  Relying on lemon and ginger tea and ginger biscuits to quell nausea when it starts aswell as the anti sickness . appetite not brilliant but I know it will improve next week x .hope everyone else is not suffering too much x Dorothy
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hello again all . well first cycle of FEC has been ok on the whole .. biggest problem being the nausea , but coped . Hair is out and have a fetching wig and some lovely scarves . Review with onco went well today she is pleased with me .. bloods tomorrow then if all ok then FEC2 on Thursday x did anyone find that side effects got worse as cycles progress ? and has anyone else had 6  x FEC ?and no T ? thanks for any advice given Dorothy
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club
